website_summaries.verdict: If you have a sensitive animal or don't need a heavy-duty tool, this groomer is a useful alternative – but don't expect it to perform as well as other tools by the brand.
pros: Its sleek handle and rubberized teeth make it an ideal tool that is comfortable for pets and their owners
For dogs, cats, and other animals with short to medium length coats
Removes dust and other small particles
cons: Doesn't keep hair contained during grooming
Not ideal for removing deep, loose fur and undercoat hairs

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a shorthaired Great Dane pitbull mix and this was the perfect brush for her hair!! Fits in my hand well. Handle on top seems flimsy but hasn't shown any wear or tear after several uses.
customer_reviews.author: Amberly Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Best one ever for our Maine Coon Cat.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat HATES being brushed. We have bought multiple combs/brushes. She tolerated a human big tooth comb, but for only 30 seconds. Just tried this product. OMG! Not only did the cat stay to be brushed, she layed on her back and stretched out! She doesn't let anyone touch her belly let alone comb it. She fell asleep that way being brushed. I even use it to comb her hair on the pillow of the couch she has claimed as her bed.
customer_reviews.author: K.Kendall

customer_reviews.title: O.M.G., ITS THE BOMB!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE IT! I can't believe it but this really works! It's something about the "rubberized" plastic nubs that gently helps my Turkish Van"s long-hair coat come out so his shorter summer coat can grow in. My American shorthair also loves it. When brushing, the hair is very neatly container on this PC mouse-sized base. Static cling also seems to be a factor -- none of us have been shocked, tho, so no worries. I have tried so many devices to keep cat hair from collecting in every corner and crevice in my apt. Nearly all, besides wire bristle brushes and lint rollers, have been disappointments and wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for short haired dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect brush for short haired dogs! I’ve used and loved the original furminator for years on labs, shepherds, and many other medium/long hair breeds. However, it would not work on my German Shorthaired Pointer. This brush works great! The loose hair does stay on her but easily brushes off with your hand. I let her run around outside after brushing to get the remaining loose hairs off. Fits comfortably in my hand with grips and a strap for a finger or two for extra grip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't write reviews, but had to for this item. I purchased this curry comb to use on my "non shedding" dog, who is shedding another dog right now. Works great on her! But, the best part is that the cat loves it! The cat would never let me touch her with any type of grooming tool, she loves this think and it is getting rid of all of that cat hair.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sauer

customer_reviews.title: Great comb even for picky cats
customer_reviews.text: I use this comb in conjunction with theand they work wonders. The comb is easy to use and gets a surprising amount of fur off despite its large teeth. My picky cat even loves this comb. But please note that it has nowhere to "store" the loose fur so it ends up culminating on the back of the comb, your arm, the back of the cat, etc so keep a trashcan and lint roller nearby!
customer_reviews.author: Katie R.

customer_reviews.title: Works for pitbulls
customer_reviews.text: I have a pitbull mix and he sheds all over the house.... This is my first dog and I had to experiment with the brushes bc none were grabbing his hairs! Finally I got this and it holds the hair so I can brush it out. So this works for that weird wire dog hair! However, the hair clings to the brush and is hard to get off. Then im brushing the hairs back onto him. It's okay though I am just happy it helps the shedding!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this comb. It works SO well on my short-haired pupper! It gets down to the skin without tearing or catching, which I've had a problem with before, and considering the quality it's dirt cheap. I expect to use this for years. It's comfy to hold, too. Be aware, though - I have large hands, and the strap on the top is so useless that I don't even bother using it. I was tempted to take a star off for that, but they sent me a grey one instead of the bright neon green. Since I prefer the grey, and considered it a very welcome surprise, I left it at a full 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: CaerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a brush my dog enjoys!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brush for my dog, who is part Lab and part Chow. He has a lot of thick hair around his neck, while the rest of him is very sleek and short-haired. He has hated all kinds of combs and brushes and grooming tools we have used in the past. But this brush he absolutely loves! He will just stand there and let you keep brushing up all of his dead furs. It's wonderful being able to happily groom him and reduce his shedding all over my house.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Presgraves

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well for my dog
customer_reviews.text: I have a Boxer Pitt mix who started sheading quite a lot after summer was over. I haven't had much luck in finding brushes that work for him to reduce the amount he sheads cause he has very thin short hairs. From all the reviews I was hopeful that this would be the one that worked, sadly it isn't. It's not a bad brush, and it does work about 5% better than anything else I've tried. At the very least my dog does enjoy being brushed with it so I think he finds the rubber points relaxing and comfortable against his coat and skin, he even lets my 4 year old use it on him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only worked on 1 of 4 dogs
customer_reviews.text: I like the strap on the back of the brush and makes it really easy to hold. I have arthritis so that’s definitely important. The shape of the brush also makes it easy to hold. It is really really really small though so that kind of makes it hard to hold. Also there’s only teeth around the absolute edges so I don’t know I feel like more teeth would be beneficial. In my experience it really only removed for on one of four dogs. I don’t know if that’s because Desmond just weren’t ready to shed any coat but I definitely only noticed it taking her off of one dog.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly B.

customer_reviews.title: Gentle, yet effective, deshedding tool.
customer_reviews.text: My german shephard mix has a long, but not necessarily thick, coat which sheds a lot-- she doesn't always have the patience to sit for a long grooming session every day. This item works great for short, quick 'brushes' throughout the day and it removes a ton of hair without getting all gummed up with the shedding hair-- I just run it under the tap when we're done and it is clean and ready to go for the next time. Works great on wet fur, too. Bonus: Suki LOVES it and will sit pretty anytime she sees me pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy W.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This brush isn't that great for bathing your pets (what I bought it for). The handle is very small and only allows 3 fingers (at most) in the handle... unless you have super tiny hands. And the rubber teeth are nestled so deeply in the brush that it's not very effective. I would have only given it 1 star, but it was cheap so I didn't waste a lot of money on it. But as the saying goes, "You get what you pay for."
customer_reviews.author: Jane Deaux

customer_reviews.title: Using on a cat and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: easy and soft to use on a cat. does not intimidate my cat, he lets me comb him as long as he is in the mood. cats are picky and different from dogs especially when being brushed. I chose this item because of the great standing brand and because it look to be the easiest to use as well as being reasonability priced. Picks up a good amount of fur and keeps it on the rubber bump teeth not falling to the floor. good product.
customer_reviews.author: Katrinka Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Too small and too hard
customer_reviews.text: Didn't really like anything about it. I guess it would be easy to hold for a child but not for adults. Thing is hard as a rock. My dog hated it as it is hard on him, even trying to be gentle. Would be better if it was larger and a little flexible, especially the bristles.
customer_reviews.author: Biggunn61

customer_reviews.title: Works Well on Short Haired Double-coat Dog
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my bulldog mix. She has a short double-coat. Her undercoat is constantly shedding off and just sloughs off her in the summer. I ordered this curry brush on the recommendation of the groomer and I LOVE IT. Works like a charm. The hair just slides off her. It does create a bit of a mess, so make sure you've got a trash can handy and plan to vacuum when done. But I got a small, mini-bulldog worth of hair off of her, so I highly recommend it. Her coat is very smooth afterward, and she loves it. The teeth are soft rubber and it's like a massage for her. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing brush! Gets that hair off easily!
customer_reviews.text: This brush does a great job of getting the shedding hair to come off. Just takes a little time sitting there to do it. One thing that I’m not liking is when you brush from neck to tail the hair can sit at the end of your brushing stroke and you have to go “collect” it with the brush but the brush is harder plastic so it isn’t the “sticky” kind where it picks it up. That’s not a big deal because overall the brush works really well at getting the hair off. My pup is a chiweenie. *when I use this with the furminator shampoo and conditioner it does a really amazing job!!
customer_reviews.author: Alisabeth

customer_reviews.title: Miracle brush
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with two furminators to help with my two large dogs (one with a long coat, one with a short coat). This is the best brush I've found for my dog with the short coat. The dog with the long coat, who hates being brushed, doesn't mind this brush, though it is slightly less effective on him (It brushes his undercoat, but doesn't do the best job on his longer overcoat). Still, this is a must for any dog with medium to short hair, and it's super cheap. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: M.J. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Calming brush for our dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves, loves, loves this brush. We call it her calming brush because she seems to melt like butter when we bring it out. When she starts going into excitement mode and can’t still, we bring out the brush and she immediately lays down and waits to be brushed. She even rolls over to expose her belly and equally loves her belly to be brushed. Of course we are a lot more gentle when using it on her bellie. She just can’t get enough of this brush. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alice C. Huntington

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: This little brush works pretty well to get the hair out, but it ends up more just pushing a pile of hair down your dog's back rather than collecting it in the brush part. Hair eventually piles up in the brush and then kind of falls off when you lift the brush unexpectedly. My hand definitely got tired because it is awkward to hold right. The brush overall works, it could be better but for the price I can't complain, it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: JLT

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: I have three short hair dogs. All of them shed. I was hoping this would be an easy solution to cutting down on the fur in my house. It does work.. But I also hoped the brush would trap or hold the hair on the brush. It did not. But I ended up completely covered in so much fur from brushing my chihuahua. The up side was, I brushed myself with it and got majority off. So I guess it's still a win. I couldn't upload pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Deven Deville

customer_reviews.title: My short-haired dachshund loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My dachshund loves being brushed and rolls over on his back, insisting I brush his tummy. It makes his coat shiny and gets excess hair off. The only thing I don’t like is it doesn’t grab the hair in the teeth so I have to pick the fur that it gets off on him and it kind of makes a mess. I think this is because my dog has such a short, slick coat. It’s not that big of a deal because it does a great job. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Didn't grab one single hair.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't grab the hair at all. On a German Shepherd pup who is shedding pretty good, this thing came away clean. The dog didn't like it either. I have very small hands and I could barely fit 3 fingers under the strap to hold it. So, it is small and useless. I guess the upside is that it will stay fairly clean. Not pleased with the product. Let's see how the owner is about returns. I'll update my review later. But, for now, it stands.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann

customer_reviews.title: This thing works!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works wonders! My Bella has been shedding terribly. Fur everywhere and it's one of those things that drives me crazy. I ordered this comb and omg the fur comes off super easy. My Bella is not that big only like 15lbs and she has short hair. I brushed her and wow I was shocked to see how much hair it removed. I ordered 2 so one I use on her and the other I use on the furniture and area rug. I just wish it was a tad bit smaller and had a handle instead of the in the palm type.
customer_reviews.author: Aquarius 101

customer_reviews.title: Works well on Doberman and German Shephard
customer_reviews.text: I have the regular straight furminator brush for my dog and my parent's dog. I think that this works just as well and seems less abrasive. One thing that I did notice is that it seems to distribute their natural grease throughout their fur so it may lead to more baths. I am not sure if that is a good or bad thing. Both dogs enjoyed being brushed but I do suggest doing this outside as there is a lot of shedding.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Nice Grooming Tool
customer_reviews.text: I have an original Furminator tool and my Labrador will no longer tolerate it (he's older and I think his skin is more sensitive). I bought this to try and he doesn't mind it! He will let me brush him and remove excess fur. I do feel it is not as effective as the original Furminator tool -- it takes more effort to remove excess fur -- but it's worth the extra effort on my part to help my pup.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly F

customer_reviews.title: Seriously works!
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a deshedding brush for my redtick-pit mix for a while. I’ve tried many brushes before this one. Let me just say I LOVE this brush. My dog has short-medium corse hair and seems to always be shedding. He sheds more than my long hair dachshund. While this brush may not collect the hair on it, it definitely removes loose hair and all of it ends up on the floor. No more hair getting all over clothes, bedding, or couches. I highly recommend this to others. For the price you just can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Hollie Justice

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not easy to clean out
customer_reviews.text: The brush does take loose fur off my cattledog mix. The handle is a very tight space for a hand. I think it would be hard for anyone with bigger hands to fit. My dog seems to enjoy being brushed with it. The hair is hard to get out of the brush though with the way the nubs are set up. I had a round curry brush before, and you could just pull the hair off like with grooming gloves. The furminator curry holds onto the fur.
customer_reviews.author: SLS

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC product. I have two cats and one medium ...
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC product. I have two cats and one medium dog, and have been using this curry in combo with the shedding tool and short hair brush for the last few days. Results are fantastic - tons of loose undercoat has been shed, and everyone feels smoother. The curry can be used to get pet fur out of the carpet, too! Just brush it :)
customer_reviews.author: Kel

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!  Even for Short Hair
customer_reviews.text: My Pitt-bull sheds so much. But this is the best comb ever. I thought I was removing a lot of hair before, but when I use this brush so much more hair comes out and its so easy the next time to brush him. I have a very large pitt and he is white and brown and now the hair isnt all over the place because i can brush him so easily outside and this brush is such a huge help. It really finds all the loose hairs and so easy to use and clean... Get one or two for your dog and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: KarenWasHere

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget is incredible. I am sure successive sessions will not prove to remove quite this much excess hair, but round one was amazing. And the wad shown above was only about 2/3s of what I removed the rest blew away before I could gather it up. Only wish it provide some way to suck the hair into a bag or canister for easy disposal. My dog really liked the massage of the nubs but this must be performed outside.
customer_reviews.author: a-n-m-erino

customer_reviews.title: Great brush for Boxers
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my girl. She has very short hair, and no undercoat. Just wanted something that would be gentle on her skin and get rid of loose hair. It falls to the ground like needles off a Christmas tree! She loves it too. Massage effect.
customer_reviews.author: LA MINERALS

customer_reviews.title: Don't know what the purpose of this is...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item initially for my short hair cat that sheds. I thought this comb with a few strokes would collect the stray hairs that I always see come off my cat when I stroke him with my hands, but this comb did nothing. Would've returned it if I had not missed the return window. I use this comb now for my cat's monthly bath, I use it to lather the shampoo into his fur. I guess that's something...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best brush for my lab mix
customer_reviews.text: we have tried many brushes for my lab mix but have constantly struggled to find one that worked. This one has been the best so far. WE use it during bathing as well as multiple times a week to help with the pesky shedding. I was skeptical to order as we had already tried so many products but this one is a winner! I would recommend to anyone looking for a brush to for their lab mix.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Didn't really do the trick.
customer_reviews.text: I got this particular comb as it was recommended on other sites for Boston terriers. Unfortunately for me it doesn't seem to do anything on my pup. You can scritch her with your fingers and fur flies everywhere but with this there is nothing. Also, these things are tiny. Like the size of miniature laptop mice. I can only get like 2 fingers between the strap and the brush.
customer_reviews.author: Andy G

customer_reviews.title: Love it for my smooth haired chihuahuas!
customer_reviews.text: Ever since using this, my allergies have been more at bay, I rarely get hives from my dogs because of the shed hair control. It’s super easy to clean which I love, but you should wear clothes u dont mind getting dog hair on because a good majority of the hair flies off with each brush against the grain (part of it staying on the brush) but again my dogs are usually groomed on my lap anyway. Definitely does distribute the natural oils in their fur making them shinier and smoother. Highly recommend for smooth haired dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Tiara M

customer_reviews.title: ... furminator for my long haired chihuahua and it works awesome but it doesnt work on my short haired dachshund
customer_reviews.text: I have the regular furminator for my long haired chihuahua and it works awesome but it doesnt work on my short haired dachshund. So i read a rubber comb is good for short haired dogs so I bought this. It makes her fur look soft but it doesn't get any hair out of her coat. And the comb isn't so much flexible rubber teeth, it is more like hard plastic teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: It this a joke?
customer_reviews.text: I don't get it. Lots of good reviews and comments so I ordered one for my kelpie/pit mix. This thing is a little larger than a bar of soap. It has a strap that supposedly loops over your hand, but it's so small only a few fingers can fit. It doesn't fit in my palm at all. It doesn't remove any loose hair. The material (plastic?) Just slides over her coat without doing anything. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Not really to remove hair...
customer_reviews.text: I have a dalmatian and would probably use this to scrub him with shampoo but when it comes to dry combing, it doesn't really get rid of hair. If anything the shedding it temporarily worse right after using this but the comb doesn't actually remove the hair itself, that fun comes later. Can't complain since it was inexpensive but I did have to purchase 2...
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: My GRUMPY dog LOVES this! Bit too small for my hand.
customer_reviews.text: O.M.G.!!!! My grumpiest dog who HATES to be touched, LOVES this curry comb. He looks like he's in a trance when I brush him!!! He normally growls & snaps when being brushed. We love Furminator products but this is all of our dogs' favorite! My one and ONLY problem with this is that it is too small for my hand and very awkward to brush with. BUT Chewie loves it, so I will deal with awkward!
customer_reviews.author: Jan W.

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it and so do I
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this very long but this is the best tool I have found that my Pitbulls love. It works great on there coat. It doesn't hook on bones, snag, poke, pinch, or pull. It works well on my senior Coonhound mix too. I think they like it because they are kinda being massaged. It gets more loose hair than I have ever seen come off my dogs. This is the BEST thing I found.
customer_reviews.author: Horse Crazy

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the best for short/medium haired dogs. I have tried many other items to get the hair off of my dogs but this is the answer!! After about 5 minutes of brushing, my dog went to sleep! I have two rescue dogs that shed A Lot! This comb really does the trick. Buy it. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: happy wife

customer_reviews.title: It works and lifts off the dead fur just like it says!
customer_reviews.text: Our chiweenie DaVinci isn't spoiled at all with this new brush ha! He absolutely loves it. He will only hold still for about a minute or two before he told on his back and begs me to brush his tummy! He's a mixture of not skin short fur but longer than a typical mix. The furminator lifts off quite a bit of fur I was very surprised but happy. Not so much hair in our bed now a big bonus! I'll definitely buy more of this brand and a backup furminator for sure!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer F.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried this with my beagle mix and my doberman mix and it basically grabbed no hair. Looking at it, I'm not sure why it would. The little bubbles are spread out. I got it for cheap so not worth returning but I wouldn't recommend, either. The Petpal Curry Comb or Furminator deshedding tools worked well, though.
customer_reviews.author: The Machine

customer_reviews.title: I dont know...
customer_reviews.text: This just really didn't do much for me. I guess it would be good for working shampoo into your dogs coat in the shower, but I was hoping I could use it to grab on to my dogs loose hairs after I brushed him. It probably picked up less hair than I could with just my hands, and my dogs sheds a lot so I figured he would've been a good candidate. It may work great just not in the ways I wanted it to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not even a good brush. .
customer_reviews.text: This product was not what i thought. I thought it was a smaller version of furmanator it is not. I was going to use as a backup brush when i relaized this, but its inefficient for a brush too. Its got some plastic hard knubs that dont really do anything. And to make matters worse I had to order 2 to even get one. SMH. Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: Chriss Lee

customer_reviews.title: A must Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a short hair chihuahua, but you would think I have a husky and from the amount of hair he sheds. My dog enjoys the bristles, and I be too busy staring at the mass of hair coming off of his little body. The brush grip and strap makes brushing ease, and it catches the hair pretty well, but I would advise that if you have a pet that sheds a lot like mine to do it on a towel. The brushes are not going to collect as much, but it is easy to remove the hair from the brush with no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Christian S

customer_reviews.title: it’s like magic
customer_reviews.text: You look at this thing with absolute skepticism and ask, “how does this thing remove the fur?”... well it does! I have no idea how, but it does. At least for a GSP it works great. The best part is my dog doesn’t complain and seems to love the massaging effect it gives. He complained about the wire brush and totally isn’t a fan. Got this thing and zero complaints. Would totally suggest anyone who has dog with sensitive skin to get this.
customer_reviews.author: nb

customer_reviews.title: doesn't do the job particularly well
customer_reviews.text: I really like the furminator metal comb but this thing doesn't pull fur off a quarter as well as the various nubbed gloves I have had over the years. Waste of money for me. I should send it back but I used it on my dog so that doesn't quite seem right. I let it sit in a drawer and eventually find someone to give it to.
customer_reviews.author: The Man Behind the Curtain

customer_reviews.title: Both me and my dog’s favorite !!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this comb! All I have to do is show it to my dog and she comes running to me for more! FYI - it’s not the type of comb/brush that keeps the hair removed on the bristles, it’s more of a shedding tool that gets tons of hair off the dog and in the floor. It’s awesome how much hair it removes! Love love love it
customer_reviews.author: ShoeFan

customer_reviews.title: Teeth are too hard and don’t grab the fur
customer_reviews.text: This is all plastic... including the teeth inside the brush. It doesn’t pull out the loose fur and our pets hate the feel of it scraping across their backs. It’s too hard and has no give. I will go back to using my old brush with the hard rubbery teeth until I can find a good replacement.
customer_reviews.author: sjc

customer_reviews.title: My bare hand takes more hair off
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and it seemed like it would at least get the job done at a cheap price. IT LITERALLY DOESN’T DO A THING! The dog likes it as a massage tool but it doesn’t take off a single hair. Stroking my dog with my bare hand takes more hair off. I have a Short haired wiener chihuahua mix
customer_reviews.author: Alba Quintanilla

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This has worked wonders for my Blue Heeler. He sheds so very badly. My "fur"niture and clothes are always covered, so I hope in time this will help with the issue. It's easy to use and clean. Did I mention that the first time I used this I collected 2 or 3 handfuls of hair? Well, I did! Just buy it and see for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for Great Danes
customer_reviews.text: I have a great dane. This brush is tiny! On its own it didn't do a great job of removing hair. I recently ordered the King Komb DeShedding Tool & that worked WONDERS! After a couple strokes with the king komb, I used the furminator curry comb to pull the detached hair off and it worked very well. The hair does kind of stick to the brush. For the price, it was worth it.. not totally useless, but it definitely doesn't work well on its own... at least for short haired doggos!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great for my small mutt
customer_reviews.text: I have a mixed breed little mutt. Our guess is terrier/chihuahua/Pomeranian. Hi hair is slightly coarse and long. I love how well this brush works to clean up his coat and it does a great job at deshedding him. He seems to like me using it, although I tend to really brush him down good when I do it so he begins to get annoyed with me after about 5 minutes. I am very pleased with this brush and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: jkstam08

customer_reviews.title: Decent unit
customer_reviews.text: This is simple to use and comfortable to hold. I'm sure it probably works well for many dogs but is completely ineffective with my short-haired bulldog. It does very little so remove any loose fur. But I don't want to rate it too low because, while it didn't work for me doesn't mean it won't work for a different breed of dog.
customer_reviews.author: T Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and gross
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly, the amount of fur that comes out with ease. I fear my dog will eventually be bald but she just keeps shedding. This comb is literally the only thing that has ever worked for my short hair. All the other combs I’ve tried seems to only get the undercoat and not the thick overcoat that she tends to shed more.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: I guess it works.
customer_reviews.text: Well it seems like it should work... Got a 2 yo Blue Nose Pit Bull from the Humane Society. Short haired dog so I thought this would be good to groom her with. Have used it twice so far, it did not remove a single hair from her. Maybe I forgot how to comb a dog's hair? Haven't had a dog in 6 years, it could happen.
customer_reviews.author: quinnrichard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent effective brush
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting it to just catch a few hair on my dog, as I groomed it just the day before. Surprisingly, even though it doesn't have any blade, it picked up a lot of fur. It must be doing deep debry removal as advertised. It was my first day today. But I am impressed. I will update again after a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: PrudentBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Good brush & great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I like this brush it slips over your fingers (well a few of them) & it makes the brush easier to control. Sometimes my dog tends to squirm around while I try to brush her but with this brush she seems to relax more. She actually stays put & enjoys it. I just wish the top of the brush was softer & the bristles too (like the plastic not so hard) so I can use it with more ease. Other than that, it is so worth the money. I would definitely recommend this brush for dogs that are difficult to brush.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: This brush was terribly ineffective. It did pull off a few stray hairs, but nothing significant was gathering on the ground or on the brush, or even gathering on the dog. I typically use the zoom groom with much better results, but i lost mine and so I thought I’d give this a try. I’ll stick with and recommend the zoom groom instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would hold the fur and allow me to "peel" it off to toss in the trash. However, it does deshed my lab but leaves in the spot where I stopped. I do have to say my Lady Belle loves it and will lay for a long time just letting me brush her so it must feel really good to her, she nudges me to keep on when I stop so I'll take that my baby is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Best brush
customer_reviews.text: I don't have much to compare this to, however, especially for the price, this has been amazing. My dog is a smooth coat that sheds ALL THE TIME. For a minute, he wasn't a fan, but then he loved it. It's like a massage on him while getting the hair off. I just use a vacuum on the spot on the floor once we are done. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Finally a brush my dog likes!
customer_reviews.text: My Great Pyr x husky doesn’t like to be brushed. Oh but how she sheds! She really seems to like the Furminator. The fur doesn’t clog up the brush and need constant pulling out like other brushes. It just falls to the ground. It doesn’t look well made, but it does seem to be quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Does nothing.
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping this would work well. It had a funky smell out the box and the black rubber parts rub off on your hands. Which could only mean it was rubbing off on my dog as I used it on him. We have loads of dogs over with short and long hair and was hoping this would help but it didn’t pick up anything on any length of hair.
customer_reviews.author: pablo

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the original Furminator
customer_reviews.text: We have two Siberian huskies and bought this after buying literally 20 other hair combs and devices. The original Furminator seems to hurt them a bit when we are raking out their undercoat and this is a dream that makes them want to sit still and get brushed!
customer_reviews.author: JJ R.

customer_reviews.title: A good brush is hard to find!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best brush I've seen so far. It is easy to hold, and my dog loves it. Not only does it remove fur, but it loosens fur that you can easily brush off with your fingers (and this brush of course). My only suggestion is to use it outside because it is so effective! No need to apply much pressure - so if your dog has sensitive skin - this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the amount of fur and dander this brush pulled from both my short haired pibble and my short haired chihuahua. The fur sticks to the rubber superbly and it all peels off in a big gross mat for easy cleanup. Their coats we're left very soft almost velveteen! Use short strokes and go from head to tail and marvel at the crud you won’t have to vacuum later on. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Short-haired dogs only!
customer_reviews.text: Omg.. Buy it!! If you have SHORT HAIRED dogs this is what you need asap. I always wanted a comb that would really de-shed my chihuahua, pitbull & terrier!! There seems to be more brushes & combs for long hair & those aren’t enough for the others. This doesn’t cut tour dog’s hair it just removes the excess. The price is hands down amazing! I wish I had known about this sooner. (Would have saved me many lint rollers)
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: doesn't do anything
customer_reviews.text: It's like a hard rubber studded type brush that doesn't collect any hair it just basically slides over my dog's coat. I have Shar Pei's and I read this type of a brush is the best but this one does not work on my dogs at all. Maybe it works on other breeds. The price was super cheap so I'm not really out much so that's a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kat J Denver

customer_reviews.title: This is my dog's favorite brush.
customer_reviews.text: I have a pit that used to shed all over the place. Since we got him this brush, the floor and his bed are no longer covered in a sea of fur. He seems to really like how this brush feels as opposed to the metal ones and will actually bring us the brush to let us know that it's time for his favorite part of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Adalia Zombiepants Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Works great!! Cat loves to be combed with this
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Didn't know my cat had so much extra fur to shed!! Works great!! Cat loves to be combed with this! He thinks he is spoiled!
customer_reviews.author: *Research*Mama*

customer_reviews.title: Great dog brush!
customer_reviews.text: Our cane corso was shedding like crazy- hair everywhere. 2 minutes spending time with this and nothing anymore. Also soft rubber makes it so that there’s no pain to him. Definitely glad I went with this over a metal brush that we used to use on our family dogs when I was younger. At least for short haired dogs, I highly recommend. I can’t speak on long haired dogs since I don’t have one to try it on.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome brush
customer_reviews.text: I have a short haired mutt doggie (white) who shed a rediculous amount of fur. I have tried a lot of different brushes and he hates them and is scared to be brushed until this furminator brush! He loves it!! And couldn't get enough!! This brush works fantastic! It took out sooo much hair! This is a must! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: stephanie h.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for my chihuahua/ pug/ beagle mix
customer_reviews.text: My only issue is that the hair didn’t stick to the comb as much as I wanted so it got everywhere but, this is the best brush out he’s ever gotten!
customer_reviews.author: M. Ritt

customer_reviews.title: Just as described. Easy yo use.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect of short hair dogs. My pup looks so much better, and she tolerated is very well. Would advise doing the grooming outside, some of my dogs fur was not caught by the brush and I did have to do an area clean after. Cannot wait to try this product with her bath.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Ford

customer_reviews.title: Cleanup is super easy, it tends to collect hair in thin ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this brush. He's an an American Staffordshire Terrier with short hair and it does the job. I find it more effective right after he gets a bath but it works well enough on dry fur. Cleanup is super easy, it tends to collect hair in thin layers that you can just peel off.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: The only brush my cat will allow
customer_reviews.text: This brush works great! It's easy to hold and much like the original Furminator, it removes lose fur easily. This is actually much more gentle than the original metal brush. My cat wanted nothing to do with that one. She'll relax in my lap and let me brush her now. So glad I found this!
customer_reviews.author: OxO

customer_reviews.title: Great for Short Haired Dogs
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. I have a Great Dane. His short coarse fur can be difficult to remove. This does the trick. It comes off in sheets! Not to mention he loves it. Feels like a back scratch for him! We also have a border collie with long hair and it did not work for her. Only works with short hair.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Not what we had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: This particular brush doesn't do much on my pups at all. I'm not even sure it removes any hair, and what does come off when using it kind of just floats to the top, needing to be brushed off and creating a mess. We've ordered a different deshedding brush in hopes for better results.
customer_reviews.author: thriftymom

customer_reviews.title: It works and it's painless
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 45 pds, has medium length hair and is a prolific shedder. I've tried a dozen brushes of all types with poor results and didn't expect much from this simple tool. But, even though she is brushed daily, after about 2 minutes of use I had an area of white hair where my dog had stood. Amazing. I am even able to brush sensitive areas without reaction. Awesome. I keep this brush handy and use it several times a day when on walks or just sitting on the porch. There will always be shedding but this little brush gives my pup a massage and helps to minimize how much doggy hair I wear to work.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Mc

customer_reviews.title: Going to keep looking
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves the massage, but the comb didn't work for me to remove hair on a short wirehair dog. I owned a similar curry comb years ago with soft rubber teeth, but this one has very stiff, hard teeth.
customer_reviews.author: c dom

customer_reviews.title: Can't really tell if it works
customer_reviews.text: My dog enjoyed the massage from it, but I couldn't tell if it was taking the dead fur off or not. Only a few hairs stuck to the brush. But when I put down my chihuahua I was covered in hair. Not sure if she just shed all over me or the brush just dumped it on me.
customer_reviews.author: Alex R

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how much hair it gets out of my cats coat. My cat seems to like how it feels also so thats a bonus. I wish the strap was a little bigger though but thats my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Vince C.

customer_reviews.title: So Much Fur
customer_reviews.text: While my 5lb chihuahua wasn't a big fan (I think it over stimulated her), I couldn't be happier with the amount of fur it removed. Even with her short hair the comb was very easy to clean with no soap/water or anything, literally just picked it clean with my fingers. I'm not sure if more hair ended up on me than in the brush, but I'm thrilled to be able to pet my dog again without feeling like I'm releasing a fur storm.
customer_reviews.author: Tignatious D

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay, leaves a mess
customer_reviews.text: Well it is gray not the neon green/yellowish like the picture but I like the gray color better so. It’s not the best out there but does a decent job. The hair doesn’t get stuck to it when brushing it just all falls to the floor so some cleanup afterwards is definitely needed.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great brush
customer_reviews.text: Best brush I've ever used on my pups! I have two pitbulls, so short hair. I've always bought slickers and wondered why there was always shedding even after brushing the dogs out. Sat down with our adult dog and brushed her for about 30 minutes- we had 3 decent piles of fur! Not only did it get all her undercoat but it made her look so shiny and her fur looks so healthy! Only downside is the little strap maybe if it was a little thicker and stretchy, seems small and flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Shaina

customer_reviews.title: Great for short thick hair dogs
customer_reviews.text: So I got this for my yorkies & husky, well really is for thick shorter hair dogs. I have a mastiff|german shepherd| border collie.. but she Carrie's the mastiff hair style by most. Well, she LOVES this tool. She is 99% outside and on a farm mainly of dirt. This tool brang up any dirt and dead skin I didnt know was there! I will add photo later
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Uncertain How Effective It Is As A Grooming Tool
customer_reviews.text: Although my puppy seems to shed a great deal if my clothing is any indication, whenever I can get her to allow me to brush her with this it never seems to capture much hair so i have to question how well such short plastic bristles actually work. Otherwise, it's a cute product. She is interested in it as a chew toy. That may be what it will become at some point if it doesn't prove to do a better job as a grooming tool as she settles to let me use it.
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Gill

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this considering how cheap it is and my dogs fur type. I have $60 undercoat Combs and a bunch of brushes for "all coat types", but nothing worked for my dog. She sheds like crazy all of the time and brushes just run through her fur without taking any of it off. I've used this Curry comb twice now and I love it! I had a pile of fur the size of my dog by the time I was done. I'm extremely pleased with the results and my pup loves it. It doesn't seem to irritate her like the metal Combs do. 100% would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Vogt

customer_reviews.title: Gentle on the skin
customer_reviews.text: My older, short hair dog hates being brushed. This is the first brush he actually enjoys! It is more gentle on his skin than any other brush I’ve tried. It’s average as a dog brush at best, but if your dog has tender or sensitive skin - this is the brush for you!
customer_reviews.author: Barry Paul

customer_reviews.title: Had to order a second!
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these and it got misplaced in a move so I had to order another one. My dog hates being brushed but she tolerates or even likes this curry comb. It’s the only type of brush that really works on her fur, which is slightly longer than a lab.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Massager more than a brush
customer_reviews.text: Short wiry straight hair dogs, does deshed but do outdoors because none of the removed hair stuck to curry comb. That was fine with me because the dogs thought they were being rubbed instead of brushed.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Morris

customer_reviews.title: Lots of hair off
customer_reviews.text: First used these on our 2 cats & got handfuls of hair off one. Same for the dog & we used while bathing. My only complaint is that the bristles are hard plastic & not rubber like you'd expect. Not so great for the older cat who is kind of thin.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey G.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats one hated it, one took the bushing for a little while than it was claw time. The one that lasted a little while I had fur flying all over the place, he has long fur. The brush does not grab the hair just brought to the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Massage Therapists View
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 star because it's a great massager and can pick up some hair. I bet it's perfect for cats. I use a stronger brush to get hair off my dogs and then I run this thru their fur. They love this combo. Grooming them relaxes me and relaxes them.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepy

customer_reviews.title: Great for short haired dog.
customer_reviews.text: My rescue dog is petrified of brushes, this is easy to hide in the palm of my hand to be able to brush her. It does a great job at getting the loose short hairs. Also because it’s plastic it’s easy to clean off.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend using this indoors because it works THAT WELL. We have a GSD who absolutely loves this thing... it was brushing our hair that didn’t come out with the other brushes... don’t be deceived by its appearance: it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: You'll be a little less hairy! Lol
customer_reviews.text: Although a bit small for adult hands it does work!!! I brushed out so much of the under coat on my Husky/Shepherd!! I've gotten other brushes bristle and metal...all worked like crap!!! Buy it you'll be happier than if you didn't! Lol
customer_reviews.author: patricia estrada

customer_reviews.title: Effective but lacking in quality.
customer_reviews.text: This brush fits great in the hand and works beautifully on my basset! It gets all the fine hair that used to find its way to my sofa. The one thing I have a problem with is that it is already falling apart and I have only used it maybe three times. Hence, the loss of two stars. Otherwise, this is a great pet hair removal brush!
customer_reviews.author: Candy

product_meta.title: Furminator Curry Comb for Dogs
product_meta.description: Size:FURminator Curry Comb with Rubber Teeth for Short and Medium CoatsAs creators of the FURminator deShedding Tool, FURminator continues to raise the bar with innovative, proprietary shedding solutions. The FURminator lineup of deShedding tools, grooming tools, hair care products, bathing and hygiene solutions broadens and enhances the FURminator deShedding experience for pet parents and their pets. Simply put, there is no pet care solution on the market like the FURminator product line. The FURminator Curry Comb is ideal for short and medium coat dogs. Use this tool to remove dust and loose hair from your pet. The Curry Comb for dogs, features molded rubber teeth to stimulate the production of natural oils to promote coat health. You will love the ergonomic handle for secure and comfortable grip as you use the tool. Give your pet the experience of professional grooming, with professional results, right from your home. Look for more professional grooming tools and shampoos in the FURminator product line.
feature_bullets: Ideal for removing dust and loose hair from your pet
Features molded rubber teeth to stimulate the production of natural oils to promote coat health
Ergonomic handle is secure and comfortable in your hand
Anti-microbial plastic helps keep germs and bacteria at a minimum.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
